revolutionary.description: The Revolutionary calendar, also known as the French Republican calendar, was created during the French Revolution. It has 12 months of 30 days each.

festivals.name: Fête de la Raison
festivals.description: Celebration of Reason, an Enlightenment concept, during the French Revolution.

festivals.name: Bastille Day
festivals.description: Commemoration of the Storming of the Bastille, a turning point of the French Revolution.

festivals.name: Fête de la Fédération
festivals.description: Commemoration of the unity of the French people during the French Revolution.

festivals.name: Fête de la Liberté
festivals.description: Celebration of Liberty, one of the principles of the French Revolution.

festivals.name: Fête de l'Être Suprême
festivals.description: Celebration of the Supreme Being, a deistic concept, during the French Revolution.

festivals.name: Fête de la Constitution
festivals.description: Celebration of the adoption of the French Constitution during the French Revolution.

festivals.name: Fête de l'Égalité
festivals.description: Celebration of Equality, one of the principles of the French Revolution.

festivals.name: Fête de la Fraternité
festivals.description: Celebration of Fraternity, one of the principles of the French Revolution.

festivals.name: Fête de la Révolution
festivals.description: Commemoration of the beginning of the French Revolution.

holidays.name: Día de la Revolución
holidays.description: Celebra el inicio de la Revolución.

holidays.name: Día de la Igualdad
holidays.description: Conmemora el principio de igualdad en la Revolución.

holidays.name: Día de la Libertad
holidays.description: Celebra el principio de libertad en la Revolución.

holidays.name: Día de la Fraternidad

holidays.name: Día de la República

holidays.name: Día de la Unión

holidays.name: Día de la Educación

holidays.name: Día del Trabajo
holidays.description: Conmemora los logros y derechos de los trabajadores.

holidays.name: Día de la Solidaridad
holidays.description: Promueve la solidaridad y la ayuda mutua entre los ciudadanos.

holidays.name: Día de la Justicia
holidays.description: Celebra la importancia de la justicia y la equidad en la sociedad.

holidays.name: Día de la Paz

holidays.name: Día de la Prosperidad

chinese.description: The Chinese calendar is based on lunar and solar cycles. Each year is associated with an animal from the Chinese zodiac and has 12 or 13 months.

festivals.name: Chinese New Year
festivals.description: Celebration of the Lunar New Year, a significant festival in Chinese culture marking the beginning of the new year.

festivals.name: Lantern Festival
festivals.description: Celebration marking the end of Chinese New Year celebrations, featuring beautiful lanterns and evening parades.

festivals.name: Qingming Festival
festivals.description: Festival to honor ancestors, clean tombs, and enjoy outdoor activities.

festivals.name: Dragon Boat Festival
festivals.description: Festival commemorating the life and death of the famous Chinese poet Qu Yuan, featuring dragon boat races and traditional foods.

festivals.name: Mid-Autumn Festival
festivals.description: Family reunion festival celebrating the full moon, associated with eating mooncakes and admiring the moon.

festivals.name: Double Ninth Festival
festivals.description: Ancient festival celebrated by climbing mountains, drinking chrysanthemum wine, and enjoying outdoor activities.

holidays.name: Chinese New Year
holidays.description: Celebrates the beginning of the Chinese New Year, also known as the Spring Festival.

holidays.name: Lantern Festival
holidays.description: Celebration marking the end of the Chinese New Year festivities, with lanterns and parades.

holidays.name: Qingming
holidays.description: Day to honor and remember ancestors, also known as Tomb Sweeping Day.

holidays.name: Labor Day
holidays.description: Commemoration of International Workers' Day, a day of rest and celebration in China.

holidays.name: Dragon Boat Festival
holidays.description: Celebration of the fifth day of the fifth lunar month, with boat races and traditional foods.

holidays.name: Mid-Autumn Festival
holidays.description: Festival celebrating family reunion and autumn harvest, with lanterns and mooncakes.

holidays.name: Double Ninth
holidays.description: Celebration of the ninth day of the ninth lunar month, with outdoor activities and mountain climbing.

holidays.name: National Day of China
holidays.description: Commemoration of the establishment of the People's Republic of China on October 1, 1949.
